intro: Pisonia fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered pisonia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly found in countries like Mexico and parts of Central America. The plant is characterized by its clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Pisonia fasciculata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate floral display.
